reviews.review: It was an great movie! My daughter loved it!

Probably because I am older, but I pretty much knew within the first half hour of the movie what was going to happen. Stories over the years are recycled and there isn't much new, so I was left watching what I already knew was going to happen. None of the songs are going to be a hit, there was really nothing remarkable except too much reliance on CGI instead of on great and original story telling. Okay, but nothing to write home about.
I really enjoyed the storyline in this sequel. It was cute, funny, and heartfelt!

After being quite critical of the first Frozen film, this sequel sets right my issues: musical consistency and gripping narrative. I loved it and was laughing, cheering and excited from beginning to end.
To long! Songs are very slow!
Incredible movie!! So inspiring and meaningful. Our whole family loved it so much that we saw it 3 times.
While it is not as good as the first, it still manages to be a great movie. My favorite parts were when Olaf chimed in and gave one-liners every one in a while.
Not bad. My daughter loved it.

The frozen franchise may have been overrated from the get-go, with the first movie having such instant success following everyone around for much of the decade. 
Although the first movie may have been rendered differently by the onslaught of merchandise, it was still one of the best, original films of the decade on its own.
Many of the children who watched the movie in 2013 will find the sequel a perfect follow up to the original, as it follows the origins of our protagonists story. 

The soundtrack may not hold up as well as the latter, but hits such as ‘show yourself' and ‘into the unknown' seem to have the potential to be really catchy songs, to the dismay of parents with young ones.
The animation seems to have only improved over time, which is to be expected of Disney.    This animation is easy on the eye, which may be a ploy is to help disney sell cute frozen merchandise of characters, such as Ana, Elsa, Olaf and new additions such as that of the stunningly animated spirits, the fire-spirit Bruni or the water-spirit Nokk, as well as countless others. 

Although not perfect, this journey into the unknown is a blast and has a satisfactory ending, Frozen 2 is to be recommended for all, not just the stereotype of young families.
